website_summaries.verdict: A traditional style of ice hockey puck from a leading brand.
pros: Vulcanized rubber ice hockey puck that has the feel and quality you're seeking
Puck's performance is exactly what you'd expect
Works great for outdoor or indoor games or practice time
cons: Price per puck is a little higher than some other options

customer_reviews.title: Did the trick!
customer_reviews.text: I used these for jacking up my car (cut out the the middle to fit the pinch welds) and these have held up great. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent multi-purpose slab of rubber. I got these to use as jackstand pads for lifting an old Porsche for some transmission work. Worked great! Four of these for under ten bucks, versus $$$ for actual jack pads... ha! These things are way tougher, offer a lot better grip than the classic "hunk o' wood" and will last forever. I use them all the time for jacking up cars now - tire rotations, oil changes, whatever. It's great! I have also used them as clamp pads when gluing things. I suppose they could also be used for hockey.
customer_reviews.author: plk1975

customer_reviews.title: Good for Hockey
customer_reviews.text: I think I am the only one who bought this actually for hockey. Normal, well made, everyday puck.
customer_reviews.author: Julius M.

customer_reviews.title: Floor jack for a better connection with the frame of the car.
customer_reviews.text: Totally liked it. Great price and very durable. Actually use this for my pitbull as a chew toy during the time her back teeth were growing. Was recommended instead of me keep mine $20 chew bones that were supposed to be indestructible and would last about five days. Also works great on Floor jack for a better connection with the frame of the car.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Summerfield

customer_reviews.title: not bad
customer_reviews.text: I am using these as bump stops on my jeep. just drilled a hole in the middle and stacked them on my shock pads. they are a nice material for this and drill pretty easily. the other nice thing is they are an inch tall so you can easily adjust your bump stops with a longer bolt. A lot less expensive then conventional bump stops
customer_reviews.author: Joey F

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased With Quality
customer_reviews.text: High quality pucks that are legitimate, I've been using them out back all summer and they're actually so high of quality I've been shooting them at goal posts the entire summer and winter and none of the pucks have any chips or abrations on them! These are a great choice to purchase for a reasonable amount of money. Shipping was faster than expected so for these reasons I give A&R Sports a 5 star rating! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Jason walk

customer_reviews.title: Great for Automotive Use
customer_reviews.text: I use these on my jack and jack stands to support my vehicles. I do not bother cutting into these, I just plop them up top and place my vehicle on top of these. They last a long time, I end up losing hockey pucks rather than them wearing out. Cheap, reliable, and +1 for making my garage smell like a tyre shop. I usually support a 2017 F150 on these, they take the weight without issues.
customer_reviews.author: Benihana

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size to fit on top of a large Craftsman ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size to fit on top of a large Craftsman floor jack. Very solid rubber, keeps me from scratching things underneath my ridiculous waste of money, and the grip makes me feel like it's more secure than just a plain jack directly on the frame. It will probably sit on my jack until the end of time, well worth a few bucks if that's what you're getting it for. Now, as far as hockey goes, I think I'm about half a country away from the nearest rink, so you'll have to read about that somewhere else.
customer_reviews.author: The Andersons

customer_reviews.title: Standard hockey puck at a great price. I saw in one review that someone ...
customer_reviews.text: Standard hockey puck at a great price. I saw in one review that someone used these as feet for their turntable. I also have an alternative use for mine that also involves a turntable. I drilled a hole in the center of mine and used it as a record clamp. Set it on the center of a record to keep it flat. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas DriscollTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: I use them as bench blocks for gunsmithing - cut ...
customer_reviews.text: I use them as bench blocks for gunsmithing - cut a few channels, drill a few holes. Then I can hammer on them with no damage to parts. Also mount to air compressor feet to reduce noise and vibration.
customer_reviews.author: T. Mark Graham

customer_reviews.title: Great for Random Shop Projects (and Automotive Floor Jack Pads)
customer_reviews.text: I've used these mainly as protective pucks on my automotive floor jack, so I don't know how they are as hockey pucks. However, what I can say is that they are really good in the shop when you need something firm with a non-marring consistency that's cheap and versatile in size.
customer_reviews.author: Marshman

customer_reviews.title: Used thses as spacers under a safe
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use as a spacer under a 1,500 lb safe. I placed six of them evenly on the floor before placing the safe on top. They don't appear to have deformed and at 1" thick provide a perfect amount of space to be able to keep air flow around the safe and prevent the bottom of the safe from rusting from direct contact with a concrete floor. Obviously I am not using these for their intended purpose but they work great for my particular need.
customer_reviews.author: C. Baker

customer_reviews.title: It's a hockey puck
customer_reviews.text: What's not to love about a hockey puck? It's round, it's rubber, it's heavy. How can you screw that up? You can't, I'm guessing. So, this is a puck that appears to meet all "pucking" requirements as far as I can tell. It appears to be correct in shape and material. I just drilled a hole in the damn thing and put it at the base of the hook on my truck's winch to protect the roller fairlead... but I'm guessing one could take it to a fight on ice in hopes that a hockey game will break out.
customer_reviews.author: SummitTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: they slide on the ice fine.  a few have chips in them after hitting the boards/glass enough.
customer_reviews.text: these pucks work just fine. they chip a little easier than some of the most expensive ones but not a huge issue.
customer_reviews.author: hockey#19

customer_reviews.title: I suppose this would be good for hockey, too.
customer_reviews.text: I don't play hockey. So, why did I buy a hockey puck, and why am I happy with it? No, it's not a tribute to Don Rickles, may he rest in peace, it's more practical than that. I bought it to put between my floor jack and my Porsche's jack points. Didn't want to mess up the undercarriage while I changed out my Snow Tires for Summer Tires. This works great!
customer_reviews.author: D. Lynch

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: Made in the Czech Republic. Have been using these as both car jack point buffer at the pinch welds, and as bump stop extenders in a Jeep. Excellent quality.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Makes for great furniture/carpet protectors.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 of these to act as load-distribution points for my home systems lab; which weighs a LOT and puts DEEP dents in the carpet and pad underneath - this distributes the load from about 3/4" circle to around a 4" circle, so now the who setup rests more on top of the carpet, rather than in it. I don't know if over time they'll mark up the carpet....
customer_reviews.author: jenksdrummer

customer_reviews.title: I hate bent pinch seems
customer_reviews.text: Bought two, cut one in 3rds, glued the two outer edges on top of the 2nd puck to create a channel for my pinch seem on my VW GTI so that I could lift it without smashing my frame. Used Plastic Epoxy (the kind in two syringes) to glue together and left in my vice overnight. Works very well, I use it as a block under my VW and my Jeep ZJ when I don't want to scratch the paint or bend seams. Works well for lifting under my axles as well. Well worth the time and effort I put into making it. I hate bent pinch seems. No more hate.
customer_reviews.author: PDXborn

customer_reviews.title: Like many others
customer_reviews.text: Like many others, I use the puck between my floor jack and beloved vehicle. The puck stands up to the weight of an old muscle car and doesn't compress much, just enough to hold it firmly in place. The jack "teeth" dig into it a little bit, but not enough to cause any permanent damage to the puck, and definitely better than tearing into my subframe. It's pretty much the best solution ever, especially if you're protecting your classic car. Oh, it also gives your jack a little more lift than it normally would have, an added bonus!
customer_reviews.author: pdiz

customer_reviews.title: Useful as pad for floor jack
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hockey puck when it showed up in a search for a pad for a floor jack. I obviously wasn't looking for a hockey puck, but the other options for floor jack pads were prothane (too soft) or rubber disks with a slot for fitting to a car's pinch weld. Ideally, I would have found a pad about 3" in diameter, but this one is 2.75" and will do the trick. Its solid rubber and was a better solution to what I was looking for, even though it was not what I sought out to find!
customer_reviews.author: Cautious

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product!!!  Love these pucks—but not for hockey lol.
customer_reviews.text: Use these on my aluminum floor jack and my jack stands. They are firm black rubber and no slipping at all. These were a hidden secret for automotive DIYers.
customer_reviews.author: Peach808banana

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought them for my son to practice the shooting. They are just the same quality that the leagues are using, office pucks. Great buy and I will buy again if I need more.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie C.

customer_reviews.title: No regrets
customer_reviews.text: I used these for bump stops on my jeep. Work great and way cheaper than other options. I use the left overs on my jack when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Twitch

customer_reviews.title: It's a puck!
customer_reviews.text: I use it as an activator for my Reiki tuning forks. It's about a third of the cost of buying an actual activator, but does the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Paul D.

customer_reviews.title: Works great for a jack on a car to prevent damaged to the underbody!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and cut a slot in it so that I could use my floor jack to lift the car more quickly/safely. Worked like a charm once it went through my table saw for a slot.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Not just for hockey
customer_reviews.text: I use it on my floor jack saddle to prevent scratching the jack points, really really really unnecessary but I don't want to scratch a part that I hardly ever see. Holds up really well too, was surprised it barely left a mark. Also if you need these for pinch welds, just get a dremel and a really sharp knife and cut it out or just pay more to have it ready out the box.
customer_reviews.author: Boris

customer_reviews.title: Used as feet for a compressor
customer_reviews.text: Since I live in the desert, I've never played hockey so I don't know if they work as intended but I suspect they'd be fine. I drilled a hole in them and then countersunk a bolt thru to make anti vibration feet for a big air compressor. For this they worked very well. The rubber is quite hard so it drilled easily with normal bits without getting all smokey or gummy. They support the compressor nicely and dampen all the vibrations, eliminating the noise and shaking I'd been getting. I'll use these for projects and machine tools in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Pucks can do more than play hockey
customer_reviews.text: By design, hockey pucks a really hard, and you wouldn't want to get hit by one for sure. But I use them for "cushions" between car jacks and automobile bodies and running gear in order to prevent damaging suspension components and body seams. You do this by cutting by making saw cuts in them to fit your purpose; there are tips on the web for doing this. They work well, and It prevents damage to sheet metal and to rust-preventing coatings under the car.
customer_reviews.author: James G, Fraser

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Automotive-Jack Pad!
customer_reviews.text: Very robust hard rubber easily takes the weight of my Subaru Impreza. It was easy enough to cut a 'V' into it with a hack saw so that it fits with the pinch weld under the car. Does it work for hockey? Probably so, but I live in Texas, so I wouldn't know. If this review has helped you in any way, please leave a thumbs up or feel free to ask questions if you have any.
customer_reviews.author: Peace, Love and Guns

customer_reviews.title: Vibration dampers for stereo
customer_reviews.text: I used these under stereo equipment and darn if the sound didn't improve. Cost effective tweak.
customer_reviews.author: W Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Jack lift pad, Hockey puck, Self defense throwing weapon
customer_reviews.text: Affordable Functional Jack pad. Dont Ruin your car by not having one. It is only a few bucks. Or you can use it for what it is built for, but I don't play hockey. Ninjas from the year AD 2016 Use this to defend against assailants when nothing else is nearby to throw. Be careful as it has been known to spur fights and knock out teeth.
customer_reviews.author: Jeuno Duke

customer_reviews.title: Puck yeah these are good
customer_reviews.text: Affordable hockey pucks. Perfect for our outdoor rink where we lost half of them until the snow melted in spring. They're regulation size and weight, nothing cheap or weird here. Just plain black pucks.
customer_reviews.author: Brave Sir Robin

customer_reviews.title: Floor jack accessory
customer_reviews.text: Used to keep from tearing up and scratching the vehicle. Durable and economical.
customer_reviews.author: Angelo

customer_reviews.title: Use as a Jack Pad
customer_reviews.text: Like several others here, I bought this to use as a jack pad. The puck is 3" in diameter and my jack tray is 3.25". Works great. I threw some double sided tape on the bottom of the puck just to keep it in place when moving the jack around, but I'm not even sure that was necessary. The puck is flexible enough to give a good "bite" into whatever you're lifting, but sturdy enough not to sustain damage. Excellent off-label use, for 1/3 the price as a similar product sold as a jack pad.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as expected
customer_reviews.text: Great for hockey practice but these are getting used as workbench cookies. More durable than more expensive, dedicated products, for a lower price.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Brousseau Photography

customer_reviews.title: It's just a hockey puck? Not so fast.
customer_reviews.text: It's a hockey puck. Not much you can really say about it? Think again. But thanks to others, I found that it can be used to protect an automotive floor jack from having metal to metal contact. Better floor jacks already have a non scratch/skid surface. I took the extra step and drilled through the puck and countersunk the bolt to secure the puck to the floor jack. This was the the best $4.00 I've ever spent. I love the smell of burning hockey puck in the morning!
customer_reviews.author: Duane Cicchelli

customer_reviews.title: Great bump stop...
customer_reviews.text: Great, legit, regulation pucks. I can't comment on how well they play though. I used these for front bump stops under my 00 Jeep Cherokee. They work great for that also! Has a nice spring to it when I hit the stops off road, and keeps my shocks safe. Ordered an odd number as I had to cut one in half to reach my desired height, and they are SOLID RUBBER throughout. Had that nice burnt tire smell when I was done...
customer_reviews.author: A2theJackson

customer_reviews.title: not used for intended purpose
customer_reviews.text: i bought these originally to put on the bottom of my 10hp/90 gallon air compressor in an attempt to reduce vibration and noise. They made an enormous difference in the amount of noise the compressor makes.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Great as a pinch weld jack pad
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my jack. Just have to saw/cut a groove down the center for frame rail pinch weld. If you found this review helpful, pleas click ‘helpful’ below. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: mick04u

customer_reviews.title: Makes a good hydraulic floor jack pad.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for use as a jack pad on a hydraulic floor jack - works very well for that purpose. You can cut a groove into it if your car has a seam weld at the jack points. I don't play hockey, but shudder at the thought of getting smacked in the face with one of these flying at you.
customer_reviews.author: A fellow named Bob

customer_reviews.title: ' These are the perfect floor jack helper
customer_reviews.text: Granted, I'm using these for a wholly different, and non-hockey habit...for me.' These are the perfect jack-up helper, which is what I'm using them for, jack pads. Even if it's thin, should be okay if the loading get a little off-kilter.
customer_reviews.author: kellyb

customer_reviews.title: Not just for hockey any more
customer_reviews.text: Nice and cheap. Arrived just as ordered. I bought these to make custom interfaces for jacks and jack stand for lifting my various cars. Hockey pucks are good for this because they are softer than steel, really tough, about the right size, won't suddenly fracture, and are cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Anon Redwood City CA

customer_reviews.title: Great jack spacers!
customer_reviews.text: I'm using these to space between my motorcycle jack and the motorcycle's frame. They are very solid and don't slip while I'm working on my bike.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Awesome jack pads!
customer_reviews.text: As others have stated, it makes an excellent pad for my floor jacks. Actually, it's the best padding I've ever used for my jacks. Doesn't come apart and very well made. Will buy again if I get another jack. I can understand now why hockey players lose their teeth.....this thing is a heavy chunk of rubber, and would hurt like hell if it hit me! LOL!
customer_reviews.author: StayPuff

customer_reviews.title: Might be a good Hockey Puck - Is a Great Jack Pad
customer_reviews.text: As with the other reviewers, I have been using this as a jack pad. It's the first hockey puck I've owned. The first time I used it, I was delighted. I have a car that I care about and wanted to last, and my metal floor jack was starting to damage the jack points. This hockey puck completely fixes the issue! I highly recommend one or two.
customer_reviews.author: The Skillet Head

customer_reviews.title: Alabama is hockeyless.
customer_reviews.text: I keep seeing these listed as hockey pucks. Like everyone else, I use them for picking up Corvettes and other fragile wussy foo foo cars on my lift. If everything had some sort of frame under it like most vehicles, I wouldn't need them at all. Well, unless a hockey game breaks out here in Alabama.
customer_reviews.author: Dorkspawn

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: It's a hockey puck! What else can be said? I purchased it to use a floor jack to lift cars at the pinch weld. You do this by slotting the puck and then placing the puck between the floor jack saddle and the frame. Of course make sure the pinch weld is in the slot. Works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Marianne Sellers

customer_reviews.title: Not used for hockey
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for use as a gunsmiths bench block. Its basically the same thing anyway, a firm block with a soft-ish, non-marring surface. I just drilled a hole in it and BAM, instant tool. Saved me like 30 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: Makes an excellent jack adapter
customer_reviews.text: Makes an excellent jack adapter. I use it for my rear jack point on my car where the rear frame braces meet and the flex of the rubber is just enough to distribute the weight of the car properly around the mounting bolts.
customer_reviews.author: Rusuh

customer_reviews.title: Great as a cushion pad on a jack
customer_reviews.text: Honestly my days of paying hockey are done (or on hold) but now-a-days I use it as cushion pad on my 3 ton jack when lifting vehicles. It works excellent for that.
customer_reviews.author: The Mighty M.

customer_reviews.title: Great pucks for automotive use
customer_reviews.text: Great pucks for automotive use. What, automotive you say? YEP! I use them on top of the floor jack to grip painted/powder coated frames while jacking. Make sure the ones you order are vulcanized rubber all the way through and your good to go for that application.
customer_reviews.author: RegularJoe

customer_reviews.title: Love pucks
customer_reviews.text: My son loves these he uses them all the time to hit his targets for the net
customer_reviews.author: Heather L. Neubauer

customer_reviews.title: Not only for shots on goal!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to put under the legs of a credenza in the basement. The basement is SUPPOSED to be waterproof, but do you want to chance it? No, I didn't either. So, the solid wood credenza that holds electronic equipment (TV, DVD, etc.) is now up on hockey pucks. The furniture is black, pucks are black, no one will notice. And I'll have piece of mind.
customer_reviews.author: SannyTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: so far it seems to be working fine. No complaints
customer_reviews.text: I use it with my floor jack to prevent scrapes and scratches on the underside of my vehicles, so far it seems to be working fine. No complaints. P.S. I'm pretty sure it would also make a great hockey puck. Lol
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: lift Pads
customer_reviews.text: I am using these as lift pads, they appear to be very sturdy, and should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: H. Chu

customer_reviews.title: but it'll work fine for a pickup / amateur game
customer_reviews.text: It's a hockey puck. I don't know what else to say; this probably isn't what they're dropping at the Winter Classic, but it'll work fine for a pickup / amateur game. More importantly, it's a cheap hunk of high-durometer rubber, and can therefore be used for all sorts of things around the house, such as a jack pad, spacer, bushing, vibration damper, etc. Grab a few and keep them in your tool box; I've found all sorts of uses for these.
customer_reviews.author: David T Melchiore

customer_reviews.title: Great for jacking up pinch welds (with a groove cut in it).
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use as a jack pad for the pinch weld flanges on my Cavalier. I cut a nice deep groove in it with an assortment of tools (this thing is pretty resilient to, well, any type of modification). Works far better than trying to jack up right on the flange and hope it doesn't crumple over.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle P.

customer_reviews.title: Good for gunsmithing.
customer_reviews.text: I actually buy these to cut/mold them into blocks for gunsmithing. Their texture does well for being something solid enough to pound against, but soft enough to not abrade the surface, and potentially scratch the blueing on a firearm.
customer_reviews.author: John Scout

customer_reviews.title: spreads the pressure better, and gains another inch
customer_reviews.text: I use them on my automotive jack stands after cutting V-shaped line on top of it. This prevents any damage to underbody sealant, spreads the pressure better, and gains another inch. Works perfectly in preventing damage and seats the the car safely.
customer_reviews.author: Linus

customer_reviews.title: Best hockey puck ever made
customer_reviews.text: this puck is the puck of pucks. If I was born again as a hockey puck I would want to be this every puck. It is high quality, uniform in color and density. If you are in the market for a hockey puck buy this puck. You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: I was too cheap to pay $20 for a rubber ...
customer_reviews.text: I was too cheap to pay $20 for a rubber pad for the jack and found this. Wow I did not know there was so many use for this Hockey puck. I have 3 pucks I used now. two of them I drill a hole and have a 3/8 bolt on it to keep it center on the jack and car.
customer_reviews.author: Alex S

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for stick and puck!
customer_reviews.text: If you want to hockey, get these. Good deal for sure. Solid quality... If only I could keep track of them during stick and puck... Definitely get a metallic sharpie and write your name on them!
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality. Perfect for machine base projects
customer_reviews.text: Nice solution for making a solid machine base. See the internets if you don't know what I mean: "hockey puck machine base". Great quality, consistent, no mold marks or chaff- just solid puck-like density to rest my 400lb machine on.
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: Perfect armorers block
customer_reviews.text: Save some money any work on your firearms with a hockey puck. Good tip
customer_reviews.author: The Pro 47

customer_reviews.title: Does the purpose I bought it for.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this puck to activate tuning forks and it works well.
customer_reviews.author: S. Sanders

customer_reviews.title: I don't use these as hockey pucks!
customer_reviews.text: I don't use these as hockey pucks, instead I use them to protect my car when I jack it up. I own 5 cars and I'm always working on one of them. These will protect you jacking points, rather than metal to metal.
customer_reviews.author: Scottish

customer_reviews.title: So far so good, I used this on my jack-stand to lift ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, I used this on my jack-stand to lift under the differential of a wrangler jku and a forester, as well as under the axle of the wrangler. Holds up well with no visible compression.
customer_reviews.author: CeeJ

customer_reviews.title: Use a Jack stand Pad
customer_reviews.text: Cut out a channel in the center of this and put it on your jack to make a protected cover pad and also use it on pinch welds.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Copeland

customer_reviews.title: Great choice for footing for appliances, etc...
customer_reviews.text: These things are excellent for use around the house to prop up things like appliances in the basement, things in the garage or anything else that needs a little clearance from 'ground zero'. No, I don't play Hockey :-)
customer_reviews.author: Wright

customer_reviews.title: Works great and lasts longer than other
customer_reviews.text: I use mine as a floor jack protector. It prevents the saddle of my floor jacks from damaging the under sides of customers cars. Works great and lasts longer than other, more expensive products designed for the purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Great as a protector pad on a hydraulic jack
customer_reviews.text: I'm actually not using it to play hockey, but as a sort of protector on my hydraulic floor jack so that it doesn't damage the pinch welds or slip off chassis lift points when I lift vehicles. For that purpose, the hard rubber composition of this puck works great!
customer_reviews.author: BCSC

customer_reviews.title: These work great on my turntable - not sure how they are for playing hockey
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to convert them via drilling into weights to clamp LP's firmly to my turntable (way, way cheaper than the purpose-made LP clamps that sell for $40 and up). So I can't speak to their utility on an ice rink. Priced right - buy several for your friends and family!
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Good for practice shooting
customer_reviews.text: Got this pack for my 9yo who does quite a bit of shooting on our driveway. Pucks definitely wear as they hit the concrete but they are holding up so far. We eventually got him about 50 pucks to shoot which let's him shoot more than fetch.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Sirimaturos

customer_reviews.title: Use with car jack
customer_reviews.text: I use this with my car jack and works great
customer_reviews.author: sean c riggs

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to put on a wreath at the cemetery for my 19 year old son. They worked fine and are nice quality.
customer_reviews.author: Peaches

customer_reviews.title: Automotive application...
customer_reviews.text: It's a hockey puck, hard to mess that up. LOL I use these to place between a floor jack and a vehicle's pinch molding to help keep damage to a minimum. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: gun guy

customer_reviews.title: Great for car jacks too.
customer_reviews.text: I put these on my car jack so that there is no metal to metal contact under the car. They work great. Never played hockey in my life. LOL.
customer_reviews.author: Hachi Roku

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to put between my car jack and the frame ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect to put between my car jack and the frame to prevent scratches. Much cheaper than buying the ones they sell specifically for car jack which are basically the same thing but with a cutoff grove in the middle of it.
customer_reviews.author: R F

customer_reviews.title: Great Jack Pad Protection!
customer_reviews.text: I use these on my auto jack and jack stands to protect my Porsche. Amazingly tough and durable, they do the job!
customer_reviews.author: Ed Machen

customer_reviews.title: Great for lifting a car
customer_reviews.text: Use it to lift cars in my garage. So far so good and no dents.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L

customer_reviews.title: Ordered as Jack Supports for My Corvette and Turbo Cars
customer_reviews.text: Most Jacks are metal-on-metal which could possibly damage softer parts. (Aluminum/Fiberglass/Fiber/etc) These Pucks can be used in conjunction with an ordinary jack to help prevent damage to the "jack-point" area. They can also be "trimmed" to fit an exact area. I will be ordering more in the near future! Thanks, Mitch
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Good way to add to your puck stash
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a stocking stuffer and to add to our growing collection of practice pucks (he's up to about 50). This is a good way to add a dozen pucks to your stash. We don't use the little bag they come in, we just dumped them in the bucket with the rest of them. These are good heavy duty pucks. My kiddo uses them for his outdoor practice with his goal.
customer_reviews.author: SuthrnCat

customer_reviews.title: Hockey Pucks
customer_reviews.text: Order received on time, in new condition and without issue. No problems with the order and would re-order again.
customer_reviews.author: S. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: They're Hockey Pucks.
customer_reviews.text: They're Hockey Pucks. They look like hockey pucks, they function like hockey pucks. They don't explode when you hit them with a hockey stick.
customer_reviews.author: M_

customer_reviews.title: They're pucks
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for hockey practice. Same weight as regulation puck and they're exactly what we needed to get off a lot of shots without having to go after each puck after each shot. I don't really ever use the net that they came in though since I just throw all my pucks in a milk crate for easy retrieval and storage, but I can see how the net could be good for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher F.

customer_reviews.title: probably the best use for them in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: Used 8 of these instead of aftermarket bump stops for my lifted Jeep Wrangler, probably the best use for them in my opinion, but then again, I'm not a hockey fan. Seem well made for my purposes.
customer_reviews.author: James Cole

customer_reviews.title: Turntable bases to extend legs
customer_reviews.text: I don't play hockey. I am using them for a base for my turntable, stacked 2 high so I can put my phone stage Cambridge cp-2 underneath my audio technica at-lp120 underneath. Truly a slick setup
customer_reviews.author: the king

customer_reviews.title: A&R Sports Ice Hockey Pucks (12)
customer_reviews.text: They're pucks, they arrived as advertised but I'll be using them as isolators for vibration on machinery... I would buy them again...
customer_reviews.author: Raa

customer_reviews.title: A&R Sports Classic Ice Hockey Puck
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these to use as jack pads. Have not used them yet but they look like they will do the job & based on what others have said. Nice price too...saving a trip to the store.
customer_reviews.author: RTMIII

customer_reviews.title: Good for more than one thing... ;)
customer_reviews.text: Using these for spacers under my 2 post car lift for my Porsche. As good as the $10 a piece spacers sold elsewhere and gives me the clearance I need between the lift arms and the rocker panels.
customer_reviews.author: BrianInAz

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, strong and quick combined shipping.
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect solution for my car jack instead of using a piece of wood:) Add it to an existing order and don't pay shipping. You can also use it to play hockey when not working on your cars.
customer_reviews.author: Twistedwankel

customer_reviews.title: The classic ice hockey pucks arrived undamaged and on time ...
customer_reviews.text: The classic ice hockey pucks arrived undamaged and on time. They are as advertised. I and my family are using them for lifting newer cars and supporting them. I cut a slit in the center of the puck.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas ll

customer_reviews.title: Its a puck
customer_reviews.text: Works awesome zip tied to my Rzr gas pedal for my short legged girlfriend.
customer_reviews.author: Robert F. Hierholzer

customer_reviews.title: great deal
customer_reviews.text: great deal. I use these for other purposes and have bought them before - they hold up to almost anything and I'm very happy w/ them.
customer_reviews.author: damon

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as shown
customer_reviews.text: Great buy! My Daughter uses these to just shoot in garage. Love the mesh bag for easy clean up and storage.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Excellent furniture lifts.
customer_reviews.text: I got these to lift my desk at work. They work great for that. No idea how they work for playing hockey.
customer_reviews.author: A. Schultz

customer_reviews.title: PANTHER CHASE
customer_reviews.text: Today, 09/24/15, I received the product and I'm quite happy with it. I own a 2003 FORD CROWN VICTORIA POLICE INTERCEPTOR and the car weights over 6000 ibs. Now,I could jack up my car without the fear of damaging the lifting points.
customer_reviews.author: bulldog2927

customer_reviews.title: Black, round hockey puck-wow!
customer_reviews.text: It was round, black and just like a hockey puck. Oh yal it is a hockey puck. How do you review a hockey puck? I guess I can say it is really pucky??? Don't you just love computer generated responses to orders? Einstein was correct when he said that technology woyld turn society into morons.
customer_reviews.author: steven

customer_reviews.title: Great for floor jacks!
customer_reviews.text: Great item to use on your floor jack. Just put this on the pad that lifts the vehicle and it keeps you from marring the paint of your car as well as giving you an extra inch of lift.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Not using as intended
customer_reviews.text: I use these to support Corvettes at the lift points to eliminate any chance of body damage when raising the vehicle on a hoist. Can't play hockey, don't want to fight....too old.
customer_reviews.author: Michael G.
